title: update fail (unspecified  error occurred.please check the logs for more information)
body: i need help riot please help or anyone who knows what to do

replies.body: is there a chance i could add any of you guys on skype i have no idea what i am doing?

Yeah so, I just had this problem all day and finally solved it. The problem was with creating the S_OK file, if I just right clicked and created a new file all I could create is text document files. There is a file called releasemanifest, just copy and paste that in the same folder and change the name to S_OK.

release manifest is located in league of legends/RADS/projects/lol_air_client/releases/current version number (mine was 0.0.1.148)

This works because releasemanifest has no file type, and I don't know how to create a file with no file type on win7 other that copying that file and simply renaming it.

Let me know how you go

You posted this as I was writing mine.

Fancy formatting costs you first post, it seems. Aha!

To create a blank document in Windows 7, right click on any white space in File Explorer and then create a new Text document (should have the extension ".txt"). When naming it, simply remove the ".txt" from the end of it. If you have extensions disabled (as in, you can't view them), you must re-enable it in the File Options dialogue, under View.

ah sweet, I didn't know. I had to search for folder options to find the view tab, I had the hide extensions for known file types enabled so i disabled it. I duno why but it isn't available unless I search for it. Or I just don't know where to click lol.
Microsoft has made some... weird decisions in the past.
may i add you on skype so you can explain it to me i have no idea what i am doing?

Ay, that's the exact one I get. Here's what I do to fix it:

* Close League.
* Go to "\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\projects\lol_air_client\releases\"
* Create a new, empty file in the latest version folder (usually the largest number) named "S_OK", with no extension. Open League with admin privileges, and wait.

These instructions are for Windows, which I presume you have because you haven't specified.

Best of luck.
If I have the S_OK file already, should I delete it and make a new one? Or is my issue probably unrelated to this? Thanks.

If you have the file already present, and then you open League and it's not consumed, then your problem is probably unrelated. Is it the exact same issue, that is, you get to 32% complete and then it says "Unspecified error"?
you could always move the original file to desktop and create a new one in the folder, if it doesn't work you can move the original file back and know if your issue is something else or not.
